pullRequest.title: JITHelpers for flattenable fields
pullRequest.bodyText:
Added JITHelpers for flattenable fields, modified existing vm
test files, and moved existing c functions.
The following are the added helper functions:

getFlattenableFieldOffset: Returns offset of a qtype field
isFlattenableFieldFlattened: Returns if a field is flattened
getFlattenableFieldType: Returnss the type of an instance field
getFlattenableFieldSize: Returns the size of an instance field
arrayElementSize: Returns the flattenedElementSize of an arrayClass

Moved following C functions from resolveField to ValueTypeHelpers

findJ9ClassInFlattenedClassCache
findIndexInFlattenedClassCache

Modified vm test cmake and module files
Related to: #9627
Signed-off-by: Oussama Saoudi oussama.saoudi@ibm.com

beforeCommit.message: Added getFlattenableFieldType and getFlattenableFieldOffset, modified isFlattenableFieldFlattened

afterCommit.message: Added getFlattenableFieldType and getFlattenableFieldOffset, modified isFlattenableFieldFlattened

beforeCommit.message: Added getFlattenableFieldType and getFlattenableFieldOffset, modified isFlattenableFieldFlattened

afterCommit.message:
Added JITHelpers for flattenable fields
The following are the added helper functions:
- getFlattenableFieldOffset: Returns offset of a qtype field
- isFlattenableFieldFlattened: Returns if a field is flattened
- getFlattenableFieldType: Returnss the type of an instance field
- get FlattenableFieldSize: Returns the size of an instance field
The Following macro was added:
- J9_ARRAY_ELEMENT_SIZE: returns the flattenedElementSize of an arrayClass

Signed-off-by: Oussama Saoudi <oussama.saoudi@ibm.com>

nodes.bodyText: make this a real helper, like the others

We dont need the BOOLEAN instanceField param, we should be able to tell since all field names will be unique. See #9880. Currently, only instance fields are qtypes, so dont worry about statics for now.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -2343,6 +2343,56 @@ UDATA
 findIndexInFlattenedClassCache(J9FlattenedClassCache *flattenedClassCache, J9ROMNameAndSignature *nameAndSignature);
 #endif /* J9VM_OPT_VALHALLA_VALUE_TYPES */
 
+/**
+ * Returns the offset of a qtype field.
+ * 
+ * @param[in] fieldOwner the J9class that defines the field
+ * @param[in] field romfieldshape of the field
+ * @param[in] instance flag indicate if its an instance or static field
+ *
+ * @return field offset
+ */
+UDATA
+getFlattenableFieldOffset(J9Class *fieldOwner, J9ROMFieldShape *field, BOOLEAN instanceField);

nodes.bodyText: this goes for the rest of the helpers
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -2343,6 +2343,56 @@ UDATA
 findIndexInFlattenedClassCache(J9FlattenedClassCache *flattenedClassCache, J9ROMNameAndSignature *nameAndSignature);
 #endif /* J9VM_OPT_VALHALLA_VALUE_TYPES */
 
+/**
+ * Returns the offset of a qtype field.
+ * 
+ * @param[in] fieldOwner the J9class that defines the field
+ * @param[in] field romfieldshape of the field
+ * @param[in] instance flag indicate if its an instance or static field
+ *
+ * @return field offset
+ */
+UDATA
+getFlattenableFieldOffset(J9Class *fieldOwner, J9ROMFieldShape *field, BOOLEAN instanceField);

you need a check here that index is not UDATA_MAX.  Make it an assert, jit should not give us bad params.
Same thing goes for all the other places its used
all of these functions need an entry in the internalVMFunctions table

nodes.bodyText: Assign this in the declaration, please. In fact all of these can be declared and assigned in order.
Like above, assign these in the declarations.
This is not legal - use J9VMTHREAD_REFERENCE_SIZE or J9JAVAVM_REFERENCE_SIZE (which means you'll need to pass in a vmThread or javaVM).

commit.message:
JITHelpers for flattenable fields
Added JITHelpers for flattenable fields, modified existing vm
test files, and moved existing c functions.

The following are the added helper functions:
- getFlattenableFieldOffset: Returns offset of a qtype field
- isFlattenableFieldFlattened: Returns if a field is flattened
- getFlattenableFieldType: Returnss the type of an instance field
- getFlattenableFieldSize: Returns the size of an instance field
- arrayElementSize: Returns the flattenedElementSize of an arrayClass

Moved following C functions from resolveField to ValueTypeHelpers
- findJ9ClassInFlattenedClassCache
- findIndexInFlattenedClassCache

beforeCommit.message:
JITHelpers for flattenable fields
Added JITHelpers for flattenable fields, modified existing vm
test files, and moved existing c functions.

The following are the added helper functions:
- getFlattenableFieldOffset: Returns offset of a qtype field
- isFlattenableFieldFlattened: Returns if a field is flattened
- getFlattenableFieldType: Returnss the type of an instance field
- getFlattenableFieldSize: Returns the size of an instance field
- arrayElementSize: Returns the flattenedElementSize of an arrayClass

Moved following C functions from resolveField to ValueTypeHelpers
- findJ9ClassInFlattenedClassCache
- findIndexInFlattenedClassCache

Modified vm test cmake and module files

Related to: https://github.com/eclipse/openj9/issues/9627

Signed-off-by: Oussama Saoudi <oussama.saoudi@ibm.com>
